misconfiguration somewhere. Please contact owner@bugs.debian.org

Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary="===============0136359889=="
MIME-Version: 1.0
From: Christian Perrier <bubulle@debian.org>
To: Debian Bug Tracking System <submit@bugs.debian.org>
Subject: boxbackup: [INTL:fr] French debconf templates translation update
Message-ID: <20080414124252.24964.23908.reportbug@mykerinos.kheops.frmug.org>
X-Mailer: reportbug 3.39-0.1
Date: Mon, 14 Apr 2008 14:42:52 +0200
X-Debbugs-Cc: 
Delivered-To: submit@bugs.debian.org

This is a multi-part MIME message sent by reportbug.


--===============0136359889==
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Content-Disposition: inline

Package: boxbackup
Version: N/A
Severity: wishlist
Tags: patch l10n

Please find attached the french debconf templates update, proofread by the
debian-l10n-french mailing list contributors.

If you do not already use it, you might consider using the
"podebconf-report-po" utility, which helps warning translators about
changes when you modify some debconf templates in your packages.

The usual policy when using it is sending a warning to translators
when you plan to upload a version of your package with debconf
templates changes (even typo corrections). Then leave about one week
for them to update their files (several translation teams have a QA
process which requires time).

podebconf-report-po will take care of sending the translators the
needed material as well as getting the translators adresses from the
PO files. All you have to do is just using the utility..:-)

Example use (from your package build tree):

$ podebconf-report-po

This will go through debian/po/*.po files, find those needing an
update, extract the translators data from these files and prepare a
mail to send to these translators (you can also use the
"--languageteam" switch to also mail the mail addresses listed in
"Language-Team" field).

You can also use this utility to request for new translations:

$ podebconf-report-po --call

This will send a mail to debian-i18n@lists.debian.org with all the
needed information and material for new translators to add new
languages to your supported languages.

If you apply this policy, please forget about these remarks, of
course....This message is generic..:-)


-- System Information:
Debian Release: lenny/sid
  APT prefers unstable
  APT policy: (500, 'unstable')
Architecture: i386 (i686)

Kernel: Linux 2.6.24-1-686 (SMP w/1 CPU core)
Locale: LANG=fr_FR.UTF-8, LC_CTYPE=fr_FR.UTF-8 (charmap=UTF-8)
Shell: /bin/sh linked to /bin/dash

--===============0136359889==
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="utf-8"
Content-Disposition: attachment; filename="fr.po"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

"the /usr/share/doc/boxbackup-server/README.Debian is recommended."
msgstr ""
"Le serveur ne d=C3=A9marrera pas s'il n'est pas configur=C3=A9. Dans tou=
s les cas, la "
"lecture de /usr/share/doc/boxbackup-server/README.Debian est recommand=C3=
=A9e."

#. Type: string
#. Description
#: ../boxbackup-server.templates:3001
msgid "Location of the RAID directories:"
msgstr "Emplacement des r=C3=A9pertoires RAID=C2=A0:"

#. Type: string
#. Description
#: ../boxbackup-server.templates:3001
msgid "Please choose the location for the three RAID file directories."
msgstr "Veuillez choisir l'emplacement des trois r=C3=A9pertoires RAID."

#. Type: string
#. Description
#: ../boxbackup-server.templates:3001
msgid ""
"To enable RAID, the directory names should be a space-separated list of =
"
"three partitions, each on different physical hard drives (for example: '=
/"
"raid/0.0 /raid/0.1 /raid/0.2')."
msgstr ""
"Pour activer la gestion RAID, veuillez indiquer, s=C3=A9par=C3=A9s par d=

"les noms de trois partitions situ=C3=A9es sur des disques physiques diff=
=C3=A9rents "
"(par exemple=C2=A0: =C2=AB=C2=A0/raid/0.0 /raid/0.1 /raid/0.2=C2=A0=C2=BB=
)."

#. Type: string
#. Description
#: ../boxbackup-server.templates:3001

"local/lib/boxbackup)."

#. Type: string
#. Description
#: ../boxbackup-server.templates:3001
msgid "These directories will be created if they do not exist."
msgstr "Ces r=C3=A9pertoires seront cr=C3=A9=C3=A9s s'ils n'existent pas.=

#. Type: error
#. Description

#. Type: error

#. Type: string

#: ../boxbackup-server.templates:5001
msgid "Block size for the userland RAID system:"
msgstr "Taille des blocs pour le syst=C3=A8me RAID en espace utilisateur=C2=

#. Type: string
#. Description
#: ../boxbackup-server.templates:5001
msgid "BoxBackup uses userland RAID techniques."
msgstr "BoxBackup utilise un syst=C3=A8me de RAID en espace utilisateur."

#. Type: string
#. Description
#: ../boxbackup-server.templates:5001
#, fuzzy
#| msgid ""
#| "Please choose the block size to use for the storage. For maximum "
#| "efficiency, you should choose the block size of the underlying file "
#| "system (which can be displayed with the 'tune2fs -l' command)."
msgid ""
"Please choose the block size to use for the storage. For maximum efficie=
ncy, "
"you should choose the block size of the underlying file system (which ca=
n be "
"displayed for ext2 filesystems with the 'tune2fs -l' command)."
msgstr ""
"Veuillez choisir une taille de blocs pour le stockage. Pour une efficaci=
t=C3=A9 "
"maximale, vous devriez choisir la m=C3=AAme taille de blocs que le syst=C3=
=A8me de "
"fichiers sous-jacent (que vous pouvez obtenir, pour les syst=C3=A8mes de=
 fichiers ext2 et ext3, avec la commande =C2=AB=C2=A0tune2fs -"
"l=C2=A0=C2=BB)."

#. Type: string
#. Description
#: ../boxbackup-server.templates:5001
msgid "This value should be set even if you don't plan to use RAID."
msgstr ""
"Cette valeur est n=C3=A9cessaire m=C3=AAme si vous ne comptez pas utilis=
er le RAID."

#. Type: boolean
#. Description
#: ../boxbackup-server.templates:6001
msgid "Generate a server private key and X.509 certificate request?"
msgstr ""
"Faut-il cr=C3=A9er une clef priv=C3=A9e et une demande de certificat X.5=
09 pour le "
"serveur=C2=A0?"

#. Type: boolean
#. Description
#: ../boxbackup-server.templates:6001
msgid ""
"The BoxBackup server needs an RSA private key and the corresponding X.50=
9 "
"certificate to perform client-server authentication and communication "
"encryption."
msgstr ""
"Le serveur BoxBackup a besoin d'une clef priv=C3=A9e RSA et du certifica=
t X.509 "
"correspondant pour l'authentification et le chiffrement entre le client =
et "
"le serveur."

#. Type: boolean
#. Description
#: ../boxbackup-server.templates:6001
msgid ""
"Both can be generated automatically. You will need to sign the certifica=
te "
"with your root CA (see the boxbackup-utils package) and put this signed =
"
"certificate and the root CA certificate in the configuration folder."
msgstr ""
"Ces deux =C3=A9l=C3=A9ments peuvent =C3=AAtre cr=C3=A9=C3=A9s automatiqu=
ement. Vous aurez besoin de "
"faire signer le certificat par votre autorit=C3=A9 de certification prin=
cipale "
"(voir le paquet boxbackup-utils) et de placer le certificat sign=C3=A9 a=
ccompagn=C3=A9 "
"du certificat du CA racine dans le r=C3=A9pertoire de configuration."

#. Type: error
#. Description
#: ../boxbackup-server.templates:7001
msgid "Invalid block size"
msgstr "Taille de blocs non valable"

#. Type: error
#. Description
#: ../boxbackup-server.templates:7001
msgid "The block size must be a power of two (e.g. 1024 or 4096)."
msgstr ""
"La taille d'un bloc doit =C3=AAtre une puissance de deux (par exemple 10=
24 ou "
"4096)."

boxbackup, which is due to be installed in the Debian FTP archive:

  to pool/main/b/boxbackup/boxbackup_0.11~rc2-1.diff.gz

  to pool/main/b/boxbackup/boxbackup_0.11~rc2.orig.tar.gz



A summary of the changes between this version and the previous one is
attached.

Thank you for reporting the bug, which will now be closed.  If you
have further comments please address them to 476090@bugs.debian.org,
and the maintainer will reopen the bug report if appropriate.

Debian distribution maintenance software

Hash: SHA1

Format: 1.7
Date: Sun, 20 Apr 2008 14:01:27 +0200
Source: boxbackup
Binary: boxbackup-server boxbackup-client
Architecture: source i386
Version: 0.11~rc2-1
Distribution: unstable
Urgency: low
Maintainer: Reinhard Tartler <siretart@tauware.de>
Changed-By: Reinhard Tartler <siretart@tauware.de>
Description:=20
 boxbackup-client - client for the BoxBackup remote backup system
 boxbackup-server - server for the BoxBackup remote backup system
Closes: 435860 440156 442515 442640 476090
Changes:=20
 boxbackup (0.11~rc2-1) unstable; urgency=3Dlow
 .
   * new upstream release.
   * update watch file.
   * bump standards version to 3.7.3 (No changes needed)
   * update frensh debconf template translations. Thanks to
     Christian Perrier (Closes: #476090)
 .
 boxbackup (0.11~rc1-1) experimental; urgency=3Dlow
 .
   * New upstream release.
     - should fix builds on kFreeBSD architectures: (Closes: #440156).
     - build against libbd4.6 instead of libdb4.3. (Closes: #442640).
     - the config file template has been updated to be more specific for
       the AlwaysIncludeFile Option (Closes: #435860).
   * remove all generated files in clean target of debian/rules. Allows
     package to build twice in a row (Closes: #442515).
   * Install file ExceptionCodes.txt to documentation directories. The fi=
le
     contains a list of Error codes found in logfiles.
   * Simplify debian/rules by removing code to build arch-independent
     packages. There are none.
